Looking for a friendly, clean, respectable gay guy to sublet a room in our 3 bedroom apartment on the upper west side (mid 70`s) for a September 1 move in.
The apartment is a duplex on the third and forth floor of a walk-up building, with only one other apartment in the building on the floor below us. The first floor of the duplex has the living room, kitchen w/ dishwasher, two bedrooms (one of them would be yours), and a bathroom. The second floor of the duplex has another bedroom and bathroom, and well as a private roof deck.
The bedroom for rent is unfurnished for $1400/month. However, current roommate would be willing to sell furniture to you, if interested. Electric/Cable/Internet is typically ~70-80$ month. Room is large enough for a queen bed and a dresser or two, and has additional storage space.
Apartment is a 2 min walk to the 1/2/3 train and a short walk to the B/C trains. Great neighborhood - with Trader Joe`s, Fairway and lots of great bars and restaurants nearby. A short walk to Central Park.
About us: we are both gay guys in our upper 20`s, have full time careers, and are pretty laid back and easy going.
First month and security deposit required prior to move in. No smoking or pets.

- Male or female (ladies, if you`ve ever been hesitant of a male roommate, I`m the best one you`ll every get)

postings.body: This beautifully furnished and absolutely comfortable 1 bedroom apartment is located in the heart of Historic Crown Heights Brooklyn, New York. The apartment is large with plenty of sunlight. It is 15 minutes to Downtown Brooklyn and 25 minutes to Manhattan. Crown Heights began as a posh residential neighborhood, a "bedroom" for Manhattan`s growing bourgeois class. Now it`s a hip urban area full of diverse people and culture. It`s rapidly becoming populated with professionals, artists, and students. In spite of it`s urban "look and feel", it`s a very quiet neighborhood. This quote from wikipedia.com best describes the area: "Crown Heights remains an overall ethnic and social melange where a wide variety of people from older residents to new immigrants and other groups continue to reside." We look forward to your stay with us.

The kitchen has your normal appliances (fridge, gas stove, dishwasher and microwave) and an eat-in kitchen. There`s lots of storage and a washer and dryer in the garage. The house has central air.
The living room is very large, fully carpeted with a fireplace and has immediate access to the large deck and backyard, perfect for gardening. I would welcome any furnishings, as my current roommate is leaving and taking most of the living room furnishings with her (though I will replace the major furniture, if needed).
I am a 32-yr old professional female working as an office administrator. I`m laid back and mellow, and love spending time with friends but never loud, late night parties. Catching up on tv, reading, and hikes or the beach with my dog sum up my weekend.
I plan on getting the house cleaned professionally once a month, due to my pup and just to relive the tension that I know comes up with sharing the deep cleaning responsibilities with others and I hope you will agree and split the cost.
I love dogs and would be open to one other, well-behaved dog. I have one 3-year old dachshund/corgi/something mix. The house has a secure backyard with a deck and a doggie door to the garage so they can enjoy indoor/outdoor space. Unfortunately cats are not allowed on the lease.

postings.heading: 8/19 to 8/22  Wyndham condo

postings.body:
Dear craigslist people,
I`m sure if you are reading this, you have found yourself in a very sticky situation --- you need a place to live, and you want it to be in the freaking bay area! We feel your pain.
That`s why we`ve come up with a way to make things as awesome as possible for everyone. In order to save money and get the most bang for our buck, we (a 20-somethings couple and our adorable dog) are hoping to find another bad-arse couple that wouldn`t mind teaming up with us to rent a 2 or 3 bedroom place in either Berkeley, SF, or Oakland. Anything close to public transport would work, since one of us is in grad school at Cal and the other works for a startup in the city.
Just to give a bit more info, we`re both very easily amused and adaptable people who have a great time living with the company of others (and tend to act a lot more like friends around other people than an annoying couple, really!). We do a lot of hiking and backpacking, as well as cooking, enjoying wine/beer/etc, working on artwork/building projects, and endless playing with our dog that I promise you`ll adore (see picture). Living in an aesthetically pleasing place means a lot to both of us, so we`ve acquired quite a bit of cool mid-century furniture to bring with us. Ideally we`d move anytime starting in September at the earliest, and find a cool dog-friendly place that has some character, for a max rent of $1100 per person.
This is where you come in! If you are a couple and are feeling the same dilemma of price vs quality vs location, then look no further. Go home, think about it, and then tell all your couple-y friends, because no one should have to live in a crappy place alone when they could live in a great place together. Shoot us an email if you`d like to start to talk and see if we can`t combine forces to land a great pad in a great area.

postings.body:
I`m seeking a third roommate to fill a spare bedroom in my home. The house has beautiful natural hardwood flooring throughout, with tile in the kitchen and bathrooms. The layout is great...with two living rooms, one connected to the kitchen and dining room. There`s a beautifully landscaped front yard and backyard with full privacy fencing around back. I recently bought a nice grill for the backyard, and there`s also a fire pit for once the temps get cooler. I`ve done a lot of gardening/planting, and you`re welcome to plant as well, but the main yard maintenance is my responsibility. The house even has a rain water tank, so there`s no guilt in keeping our yard and garden nice and green. There is laundry in the house, and also lots of room for storage in the double garage.
I have already found one roommate, looking to fill the 3rd bedroom. The bathroom and linen closet pictured are for you to share with one roommate and the last house photo is the spare room available for rent. It`s about 11x10ft. The bathroom is between those two extra bedrooms, so no one shares a common wall.
Looking to have roommate move-in sometime between now and mid September. Rent is $625 and that includes cable/internet (FREE HBO!!), gas, garbage, and water. Electricity split between all 3 housemates: about $30-$80/month total depending on the season, but split 3 ways.
I have two very friendly cats and an adorable puppy. The cats are declawed (don`t be mad, they already were when I got them). I keep the litter box clean and let them be in the backyard most of the time.
I`m a 32 year old female professional. I like to socialize with close friends, by having and attending dinner parties, backyard bbq`s etc. I don`t typically go too crazy on the weekdays, but I`m more of a night owl than a morning bird. I try to stay active with running, biking, yoga, and hiking/camping trips. I would like to live in a household of people who get along well, could possibly be friends, but have their own independent lives and goals.
You`re a happy, intelligent human, willing to offer kindness and respect to those you live with. My wish list includes gardeners, cyclists, food enthusiasts, and good conversationalists. postings.heading: Huge renovated house, 5 min walk from T, Sullivan Sq

postings.body:
Note: Some of the pics in this ad were taken in panorama, so if they are distorted that is why. I wanted a wider depth of view.
I live in a 2 bedroom, 2 full bath (each BR has its own bath) "near new" ranch-style condo in Canal Winchester. Canal Winchester is a safe, quiet suburb on the southeast side of Columbus near Pickerington and Reynoldsburg.
The condo is located off of Gender road, only minutes from Route 33 or Route 70 and is in a very quiet and safe neighborhood. There are plenty of stores and restaurants surrounding this area.
I have a nice unfurnished bedroom available. It is a large bedroom, has a large closet, and two windows. I have a two-car garage that has additional room for storage if needed. You will have your own garage door opener, with parking spots right by the front door. There are plenty of spots for guest parking next door to the condo as well. The condo is also an end unit, so there is no noise from neighbors.
Your bathroom has a very nice shower with great water pressure, is quite large, and has a marble sink with a dark cherry wood framed mirror. There is room for a cabinet or something if you would like to add anything. I just put in two new LED shower heads in the shower that fade colors and make light shows. It`s pretty rad.
The kitchen has a new refrigerator and is fully stocked with cooking appliances, with plenty of cabinet and counter space. I like to cook, and I own a large Foreman Grill, Nutribullet, Keurig, rice cooker, crock pot, deep fryer, etc, in addition to the stove, oven, and microwave. I also have a dishwasher and garbage disposal. All of this is available for you to use so long as you take care of it and clean up after yourself.
There is also a second full size fridge/freezer in the garage for extra stuff.
I also have a near-new washer and dryer hooked up in the laundry room. In the dining room is a pretty glass dinner table with a glass chessboard, flanked by a fish tank.
I recently set up a gym in the house too, so I have weights and a machine for working out on site... Convenience :)
There are two paved patios in the backyard with surrounding grass (one on the side and the other in back), and they are completely fenced in for privacy and a great play area for my dog, Cleo.
I am a 27 yr old, single, straight white male. I like sports, animals, music and generally being laid back. I am easy to get along with, (as long as you are not a total ass) and I keep my living space very clean. I work a desk job, but I try to keep my weekends free.
I love reggae music, beaches, playing my drum, travelling, and dreadlocks. I spent years travelling the world teaching scuba diving, dj`ing, and running bars. I lived in Australia, Honduras, and all over the Caribbean, Bahamas, Virgin Islands, and various places in Canada and the US. I am well-cultured, articulate, and intelligent. I also practice meditation and other forms of self-enlightenment, and I am very into metaphysics and spirituality. If you are too, you will find a little piece of heaven here :) At the same time, I love to kick it, watch my buckeyes, cook a steak, and have a beer. I enjoy company, but my house is quiet and I respect others` space. Oftentimes you may find me reading, or playing chess. Travelling the world, I have lived with people from countless backgrounds, cultures, and ethnicities.
I love animals. I have a beautiful Victorian/Olde English Bulldog and a couple of fish tanks spread throughout the house. If you are an animal lover, that is a big plus for me! If you don`t like dogs, don`t live here. LOL.
I am seeking a down to earth, RESPONSIBLE, but fun roommate to share expenses with. Someone I can get along with, have a conversation or a meal with, or kick it with and has their life in order. I would like to talk or meet somewhere so we can see if we would fit as roommates, and if so, I would love to show you around the same day.
Rent is $500 a month, includes all utilities. A refundable security deposit of $350 minimum is required before moving in. This covers everything: rent, condo fees (lawn mowing, snow shoveling), and all utilities (high-speed internet with wi-fi, electricity, gas, water, and trash). This is a discounted price. Market rent here is $900+. The security deposit is required before moving in, just as in any place.
 I do not have a standard "lease", so to speak, but there is paperwork that must be signed before moving in for liability reasons. I rent month to month. This is meant to make the room renter friendly, ensuring that no one is contractually obligated to stay if they find a better living situation for them. However, I do require a 30 day notice before moving out so I can find a new tenant.
You can reach me by sending a text message or calling
 show contact info
 or emailing me if you want more information. I am looking for someone fun, relaxed, and responsible. 420 friendly would be a plus too. :)
Cheers, and thanks for reading
~Ryan
p.s. : this ad gets a lot of spam responses, so put "condo ad" as the subject of your email, or it may not get read. ONE LOVE
cats/dogs are case by case basis

postings.body:
We are looking for a third for our Union Square, Somerville apartment. The room is small so we are only charging $550 for it. This is a steal! Come be our friend! I have outlined the pertinent details below.
Location: We are on the corner of McGrath and Washington, at the end of Union Square and 1-2mi from Lechmere, Inman, Central, Harvard, Porter, Davis, and Sullivan squares. There`s a very active bus stop across the street so trans is super easy.
The Apartment: Toilet. Roof. We just got a TV! We actually have all the furnishings for a fully functional home. We look like adults!
Who we are: We are actually adults! We are both professional females on the downward end of our twenties. We enjoy wine, reading, cooking, cleaning, beer-B-Qing, browsing reddit while watching TV, arts & crafts, bike rides, concerts, karaoke, board games made for children, and heated debates. Roommate 1 works as a scientist in Cambridge and Roommate 2 works in wine in Brighton.
Who you are: We are looking for someone with an income who is tidy and respectful. You might enjoy having a drink or seeing a concert with us. You don`t have passive aggressive tendencies or an AOL.com/hotmail email address.
The catch: No dishwasher. No garbage disposal. The bathroom is really tiny. Laundromat is a drive away; I have a car that primarily gets used for laundry and Market Basket trips. No pets allowed. There is a bunch of construction going on on the overpass so no parking in front of the house for now.
The perks: Did I mention Roommate 2 works in wine? This is beneficial. The place is entirely furnished, a basement for storage, and since you have the choice of two small rooms, you can use the other`s closet for clothing or other personal storage if you`d like. As a whole, it`s a good sized place for three people. There`s a pretty sweet back patio that has a beautiful view of the Boston skyline when the vines aren`t too overgrown. Union Square has tons of bars and restaurants, a farmer`s market, and the Fluff Festival. The location of the first official raising of the American flag is a two minute walk away.
The lease is Sep-Aug. It`s currently vacant so we`re flexible. If interested tell us who you are and what you are looking for and we will find a time for you to come check out the place.
